decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Laboratory Maniac to win the game. The key strategy is to use fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Bloom to cast Ad Nauseam, drawing the entire deck while avoiding death with Angel's Grace. This allows the player to win the game by casting Laboratory Maniac and drawing a card to win the game. The deck also includes Phyrexian Unlife to prevent damage and Pact of Negation for protection, making it a fast and powerful combo deck for Modern 1 vs 1 play.

This Naya Zoo deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. By combining powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary with mana accelerators like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to establish a fast board presence and apply pressure early in the game. The inclusion of Collected Company allows the deck to generate additional threats at instant speed, while Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt provide the necessary interaction to deal with opposing threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful interactions and combos. It includes cards like Nahiri, the Harbinger for removal and card advantage, Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch for mana acceleration, and a toolbox of creatures like Spellskite and Qasali Pridemage for protection and disruption. By using cards like Chord of Calling to tutor for specific creatures, the deck can adapt to different situations and effectively control the board while setting up for a win condition using cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Restoration Angel.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, along with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. Cards like Liliana of the Veil, Lightning Bolt, and Abrupt Decay provide removal options to control the board while maintaining a strong aggressive presence. The deck aims to have a well-balanced mix of threats and answers to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of creature beatdown and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressive creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and value cards. The deck aims to use cards like Voice of Resurgence and Knight of the Reliquary to generate additional threats and card advantage. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to find the necessary creatures for specific situations. Additionally, the deck includes various land synergies with cards like Retreat to Coralhelm and Gavony Township to gain additional value and flexibility.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to power up Death's Shadow, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Steppe Lynx to deal damage quickly. With a mix of burn spells, pump spells, and card draw, the deck aims to hit hard and fast, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is designed to support the variety of colors needed for the deck's spells, allowing for explosive plays and surprising burst damage.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and disruption to control the board, while also deploying powerful threats such as Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to pressure the opponent. With a strong mana base and a mix of hand disruption, removal, and card advantage engines like Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its own board presence to close out the game quickly. The deck seeks to maintain a proactive strategy that can outpace and outvalue the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow, while controlling the game with counterspells and removal like Cryptic Command and Anger of the Gods. The goal is to eventually cast Scapeshift to search for and put into play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a number of Mountains, dealing a large amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. Bring to Light helps to find key cards when needed, making the deck versatile and adaptable to different situations.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures with powerful equipment to overwhelm the opponent and deal significant damage early in the game. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating, the deck aims to boost the power and toughness of its creatures while leveraging cards such as Steel Overseer and Signal Pest to further enhance their combat abilities. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful artifacts, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Wild Nacatl, Goblin Guide, and Experiment One early in the game, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence. Cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Reckless Bushwhacker allow for explosive turns with multiple creatures entering the battlefield. Atarka's Command provides additional reach and versatility, while Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile handle opposing threats. The deck's mana base ensures consistency and the ability to cast spells of multiple colors.

The deck revolves around using elves to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Collected Company and Ezuri, Renegade Leader. By combining mana ramping elves with cards that provide additional value like Elvish Visionary and Shaman of the Pack, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and finish them off with a powerful alpha strike. The inclusion of disruption like Reclamation Sage and Scavenging Ooze helps to deal with opposing threats while maintaining the deck's aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful infect creature, such as Glistener Elf or Blighted Agent, and use a combination of pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. Protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing help to protect the infect creatures from removal, while cards like Become Immense provide a huge boost in power. The deck aims to win the game in just a few turns before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently enable the Infect mechanic, using cards like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent to deal poison counters to the opponent. The deck includes pump spells like Groundswell and Might of Old Krosa to increase the power of the infect creatures, as well as protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing to ensure they can connect with the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Spell Pierce and Spellskite to help control the flow of the game and protect the combo pieces.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats on the board. The main win condition comes from the powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, with support from cards like Liliana of the Veil and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while controlling the board state, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of hand disruption, removal, and efficient creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells and removal spells while using card draw to maintain card advantage. It aims to stall the game until Nahiri, the Harbinger can be used to search for Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, which can be put into play to quickly close out the game. The deck also utilizes creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage for additional control and value. Land base includes fetch lands and utility lands like Ghost Quarter to support the control strategy.
